thread.title: Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4
thread.title_full: Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4

title: Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4
text:
Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4 - FOX Carolina 21 Member Center: FCC Public File Marte's homer in 12th inning lifts Pirates over Reds 6-4 (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic). Cincinnati Reds' Tyler Holt, bottom, dives for second on a steal as Pittsburgh Pirates shortstop Jordy Mercer hops over him as he tries to catch the throw from catcher Francisco Cervelli in the fourth inning of a baseball gam... (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic). Pittsburgh Pirates starter Francisco Liriano pitches against the Cincinnati Reds in the first inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic). Cincinnati Reds starter Keyvius Sampson throws against the Pittsburgh Pirates in the first inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic). Cincinnati Reds third baseman Todd Frazier blows on his hands as he plays in the first inning of a baseball game against the Pittsburgh Pirates, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, in Pittsburgh. Temperatures were hovering at the 50 degree... (AP Photo/Keith Srakocic). Cincinnati Reds' Tyler Holt, right, dives for second on a steal as Pittsburgh Pirates shortstop Jordy Mercer leaps to reach the throw from catcher Francisco Cervelli in the fourth inning of a baseball game, Friday, Oct. 2, 20... By JOHN PERROTTOAssociated Press 
PITTSBURGH (AP) - Starling Marte's two-run homer in the bottom of the 12th inning gave the Pittsburgh Pirates a 6-4 victory over Cincinnati on Friday night, extending the Reds' losing streak to 13 games. 
The Pirates (97-63) maintained a two-game lead over the Chicago Cubs for home-field advantage Wednesday night in the NL wild-card game. Pittsburgh can ensure the game is at PNC Park with a win in either of its two remaining games or one Cubs loss in Milwaukee. 
Andrew McCutchen had three hits for the Pirates, including a home run. 
Gregory Polanco drew a one-out walk from Colin Balester (1-1) in the 12th. Marte hit the next pitch into the right-field stands for his 19th home run of the season and third career walk-off shot. He also hit a game-ending homer Aug. 22 against San Francisco. Copyright 2015 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
